MotionStar Wireless® configuration steps:

Hardware Settings

Server Address

Set server address (IP address or host name). If the value entered is not a valid host name or IP address, it will be displayed in red text. This does not necessarily indicate an error. Rather, it is simply an indication that an error might occur when the VR Juggler application is run.

Server Network Port

Set server listening port (TCP = 6000, UDP = 5000). TCP is generally the best option.

Is Master?

Indicate whether the named chassis is a master or a slave. The chassis will only be a slave when multiple packs are used. In that case, there will be one master chassis and one or more slaves.

Hemisphere

Set the hemisphere of the transmitter within which the user(s) will be operating. The Front hemisphere is located on the side of the Ascension logo.

Data Format

Set the data format to be used by the sensors. Currently, only the format Position and Angles is known to work reliably.

Sampling Mode

Choose the sample mode. Using Run Continuous will be the most efficient because the driver will not have to make repeated requests for samples, thereby saving bandwidth and computation cycles on the MotionStar chassis and on the machine where the Gadgeteer driver is running.

Sensor Report Rate

Set the report rate for the sensors. This determines how frequently the sensors send data to the MotionStar chassis. A value of 1 indicates that they should send data every cycle. A value of 2 indicates that they should send data every other cycle, and so on.

Chassis Mesaurement Rate

Set the measurement rate for the chassis. This value depends on the configuration of the hardware. The factory default is 86.1. An invalid value will have a negative impact on the quality of the tracking data.

Device Host

CLUSTER ONLY: Set the cluster node where the MotionStar Wireless® device driver will be run.

Transmitter Settings

Under the Transmitter, you will find the settings for the placement of the MotionStar Wireless® transmitter (the big, heavy black box). The orientation and position of the transmitter are configured relative to the VR Juggler coordinate frame. Remember that the transmitter coordinate frame has positive X coming out of the front (the face with the Ascension logo) and positive Y to the left. Refer to Page 132 of the MotionStar Wireless® Installation and Operation Guide (910006-A Rev C, published May 23, 2001).

Configure the position and orientation of the MotionStar Wireless® transmitter (the large black box) relative to the VR Juggler coordinate frame. This process configures what is known as a "position transform filter." The panels titled "Orientation" and "Position" present an easy way to perform this task.

Orientation

First, choose the coordinate frame rotation from the Transmitter Coordinate Frame list. To enter the X, Y, and Z rotation values directly, click the Manual Entry button and fill in the values to the right of the list.

Position

Next, set the position of the transmitter relative to the chosen VR Juggler origin. The units can be entered as meters, centimeters, feet, or inches. Make sure to pick the units before entering the location value.

Tracker Units

Set the physical units of the data returned by the sensors. Currently, the MotionStar Wireless® tracking system only returns data in Inches.

Sensor Settings
